title: Beautiful Dying Penmanship. Is there a digital counterpart?
content:
A Digital face that has any resemblance to this would be a wonderful thing?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023185000im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture10_4991.png)
author: francis bold

comments.content:
It's hard to argue with that, however I know of nothing very close. Of existing fonts, what comes to mind is Ale Paul's [Burgues Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023185000/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000267).

- Mike Yanega

Thanks Mike, Yes I am familiar with Burgues Script which does bare some resemblance to this. This script takes on a very upright positioning, which is so hard to find with most digitalized versions of calligraphic script hand. Many are heavily slanted, and lack in alternate functions.

It is why clients commission original lettering : )

Michael
Not the same, but you might also like [P22 Zaner](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023185000/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/zaner.html).
